headline: Here are the candidates running in Arizona's new 9th Congressional District
author: Melissa Estrada
sentences:
Lawmaker fined $62K for not disclosing donors, pays $1K Arizona could take oversight of toxic coal waste disposal Election deniers file lawsuit to ban machines Biggs said to push early for alternate electors
Adam Morgan
Adam Morgan is a technology software specialist, who has worked with federal, state and local law enforcement.

Randy Kutz
Randy Kutz is a U.S Marine veteran, who formerly worked as the chief of staff to former U.S Rep. Trent Franks, R-Ariz.
As stated on his campaign website, Kutz is running to represent Arizona's 9th congressional district, "to change this ominous direction we are heading and set us back on track."

Some of the issues listed on Gosar's re-election website are protecting religious freedoms, supporting cuts to government spending, balancing the budget, opposing efforts to create a national gun registry and passing legislation that violates the Second Amendment.

Announcing on his campaign Facebook page that he will now be running for Arizona's new 9th Congressional District, Gosar said bye to the cities and counties no longer in his district while introducing himself to the district's new areas.
Under the Ballotpedia's Candidate Connection Survey, Morgan listed the three key messages of his campaign website as, "Restoring honor and integrity to the leadership of my district.
Campaign issues listed on Kutz's campaign website include border security, which Kutz wants to boost by finishing the border wall and improving equipment and Border Patrol staffing.
Following the approval of Arizona's Independent Redistricting Commission's Final Draft Map, the state's congressional districts will look a little different this election cycle.

Here are the candidates running for Arizona's new 9th Congressional district:
Republicans:
Sandra Dowling
Sandra Dowling once again is running to represent Arizona in Congress.
Rep. Paul Gosar, R-Ariz., the incumbent in what will become the new 9th Congressional District, is seeking reelection in a district heavy with Republican challengers.
Morgan's campaign website lists his campaign platform of protecting the constitution, growing economic prosperity, protecting the border and serving the community.
Morgan wants to uphold the rule of law and preserve the U.S Constitution, such as fighting to ensure the federal government doesn't overstep states' rights.
Arizona's new 9th Congressional District covers most of the state's western border, covering parts of La Paz, Maricopa, Mohave, and Yuma counties.

Paul Gosar
Paul Gosar was elected into Congress in 2010, representing northern Arizona's 1st Congressional District, where he served one term.
Dowling's candidate information on the Arizona Secretary of State website states she is "an experienced leader and business entrepreneur."
Under these campaign platforms, Morgan lists strict policies and strong border policies to strengthen border protection.
Gosar is a strong ally of former President Donald Trump and echoed the baseless 2020 election conspiracies he promoted.
Morgan is pushing for new legislation for Arizona's mining industry to provide materials for the U.S and the military.
To combat inflation and the help the economy, Kutz aims to support legislation that would help balance the budget.
Dowling previously served as the Maricopa County school superintendent and is a U.S. Marine Corps veteran.
As a member of the U.S House of Representatives, congressmen serve two year terms with no term limits.
After redistricting, Gosar ran and won to represent Arizona's 4th Congressional District in 2012.
Dowling, a real estate agent, was the president and CEO of a West Valley insurance agency.
Critics also have accused him of helping instigate the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.
Kutz hopes to protect national security by protecting the state's military bases.
Natural resources and election integrity are other campaign issues cited by Kutz.
Dowling previously ran to represent Arizona's 8th Congressional District in 2018.
Morgan also would work to strengthen cybersecurity to fight foreign cyberattacks.
Morgan was a ranger and airborne-qualified infantry officer in the U.S. Army.
Dowling has not yet filed paperwork with the Federal Election Commission.
Before winning public office, Gosar practiced dentistry for 25 years.
(And) Create economic prosperity and reduce wasteful spending.".
Protecting the Constitution and American Democracy.
The GOP primary election is Aug. 2.
